poem:
Title: Amidst The Political Fray

In the throes of such partisan blight,
Labour, hopeful, turns its gaze to a cause right.
Gaza, a wound, seeping with old pain,
Inscriptions of support, they seek to regain.
McFadden, the vanguard, in searching stride,
In the hearts of lost voters, seeks to reside.
Yet, the flinty road of politics unfurls,
With each promise whispered, another world twirls.
